result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vinicio M. Jack

defendant.name: Jack, Vinicio M.
defendant.address: 2177 Wildcat Ln. PO Box 732, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Defendant Vinicio M. Jack in court.  Attorney Richard John Shawl in court for Vinicio M. Jack.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights complied with. No victim appearing today. Sergeant Bryner sworn in to provide testimony. State questions witness. Identification of the defendant is stipulated. Cross examination of the witness by defense. Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:15 AM Defendant Vinicio M. Jack in court.  Attorney Richard John Shawl in court for Vinicio M. Jack.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Discussions had off the record regarding identification for hearing.  There was also discussion about relationship issue between the complainant and State's witness.  Defense wishes to adjourn hearing.  Granted by Court. State's witness to appear in person.  Right preserved for defendant to appear by zoom.  Defense to give prior notice to the State regarding how defendant will appear for next hearing.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:14 AM Defendant Vinicio M. Jack in court.  Attorney Richard John Shawl in court for Vinicio M. Jack.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense agrees to reschedule due to case not being on calendar. Defendant will have the choice of appearing via video only zoom or in person. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Shawl. ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense confirms receipt of complaint, waive formal reading.  Bond continued. Preliminary Hearing set for July 13, 2022 at 9:30 am

10:29 AM Defendant Vinicio M. Jack appeared by video.  Attorney Richard John Shawl in court for Vinicio M. Jack.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not received complaint.  Court continues bond. Court authorizes zoom appearance for next hearing.   Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:54 AM Defendant Vinicio M. Jack appeared by video without counsel.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is not eligible for public defender due to employment.  Petition for court appointed counsel reviewed by the Court.  Court grants petition for appointment of an attorney.  Defendant required to repay the county for counsel at $100 monthly commencing July 1, 2022.  Order to be completed.  Defendant may appear by zoom for next hearing per the court.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears in court without counsel. ADA Brown appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received complaint. Court adjourns initial appearance to May 23rd at 10:45 am to allow time for counsel. Court modifies bond to reflect a no contact with D.A. dob 1980.
